nodes.bodyText: Why do we add this package?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -14,8 +14,10 @@ bVersion=1.0
 Bundle-SymbolicName: com.ibm.websphere.org.eclipse.microprofile.config.1.4; singleton:=true
 
 Import-Package: \
-  javax.enterprise.util; version="[1.1,3)",\
+  javax.enterprise.util; version="[1.1,3)"; resolution:=optional,\
+  javax.inject; version="[1.0,2)"; resolution:=optional,\

beforeCommit.message:
Remove MP Config private feature dependency

Instead only pull in the bundle to avoid pulling in CDI API.
Also make the import of CDI packages optional and dynamic

afterCommit.message:
Remove MP Config private feature dependency

Instead only pull in the bundle to avoid pulling in CDI API.
Also make the import of CDI packages optional and dynamic

commit.message: Add eeCompatible features to private API features for EE

Remove MP Config private feature dependency

Instead only pull in the bundle to avoid pulling in CDI API.
Also make the import of CDI packages optional and dynamic

afterCommit.message:
Remove MP Config private feature dependency

Instead only pull in the bundle to avoid pulling in CDI API.
Also make the import of CDI packages optional and dynamic

nodes.bodyText: Should we make a activiation-1.1 API feature with eeCompatible in it and have features depend on it instead of pulling in the bundle directly?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -7,8 +7,9 @@ IBM-Process-Types: client, server
 Subsystem-Name: Jakarta Activation 2.0
 IBM-API-Package: \
  jakarta.activation; type="spec"
+-features=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.eeCompatible-9.0

nodes.bodyText: Should we make a concurrent-1.0 or concurrency-1.0 API feature with eeCompatible in it and have features depend on it instead of pulling in the bundle directly?
Should we make a jaxb-2.2 API feature with eeCompatible in it and have features depend on it instead of pulling in the bundle directly?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -9,7 +9,8 @@ IBM-Process-Types: client, \
 Subsystem-Name: Jakarta XML Bindings 3.0
 -features=\
   com.ibm.websphere.appserver.classloading-1.0, \
-  io.openliberty.jakarta.activation-2.0
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.activation-2.0, \

nodes.bodyText: Should com.ibm.websphere.appserver.internal.optional.jaxws-2.2 also be updated to have eeCompatible tolerates?  Would be good to update other features to use that feature possibly instead of pulling in the bundle unconditionally.  Can't remember if we wanted to pull it in unconditionally in some cases.  May want to have an API feature for the cases we want to pull it in unconditionally.
Should we make a jms-2.0 API feature with eeCompatible in it and have features depend on it instead of pulling in the bundle directly?
Should we make a jaxrs-2.0 and 2.1 API feature with eeCompatible in it and have features depend on it instead of pulling in the bundle directly?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,7 +8,8 @@ IBM-Process-Types: client, \
  server
 Subsystem-Name: Jakarta RESTful Web Services 3.0
 -features=\
-  io.openliberty.jakarta.activation-2.0
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.activation-2.0, \

nodes.bodyText: This is not from your change, but the maven coordinates seem wrong.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,7 @@ WLP-DisableAllFeatures-OnConflict: false
 singleton=true
 IBM-Process-Types: server, \
  client
+-features=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.eeCompatible-6.0; ibm.tolerates:="7.0, 8.0"
 -bundles=com.ibm.websphere.javaee.annotation.1.1; location:="dev/api/spec/,lib/"; mavenCoordinates="javax.annotation:javax.annotation-api:1.2"

nodes.bodyText:
Should we make a activiation-1.1 API feature with eeCompatible in it and have features depend on it instead of pulling in the bundle directly?

Probably.  I had assumed (incorrectly) that this was part of the Java SE.  But I forgot it is removed in Java 9+
I think this can be done in a separate PR
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -7,8 +7,9 @@ IBM-Process-Types: client, server
 Subsystem-Name: Jakarta Activation 2.0
 IBM-API-Package: \
  jakarta.activation; type="spec"
+-features=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.eeCompatible-9.0

nodes.bodyText:
Should we make a concurrent-1.0 or concurrency-1.0 API feature with eeCompatible in it and have features depend on it instead of pulling in the bundle directly?

That makes sense.  Should consider in another PR

Should we make a jaxb-2.2 API feature with eeCompatible in it and have features depend on it instead of pulling in the bundle directly?

Probably, will create a new issue to gather up the requirements for these new private features.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -9,7 +9,8 @@ IBM-Process-Types: client, \
 Subsystem-Name: Jakarta XML Bindings 3.0
 -features=\
   com.ibm.websphere.appserver.classloading-1.0, \
-  io.openliberty.jakarta.activation-2.0
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.activation-2.0, \

nodes.bodyText:
Should com.ibm.websphere.appserver.internal.optional.jaxws-2.2 also be updated to have eeCompatible tolerates? Would be good to update other features to use that feature possibly instead of pulling in the bundle unconditionally. Can't remember if we wanted to pull it in unconditionally in some cases. May want to have an API feature for the cases we want to pull it in unconditionally.

Probably.  Another candidate for the separate issue.

Should we make a jms-2.0 API feature with eeCompatible in it and have features depend on it instead of pulling in the bundle directly?

Probably.  Will add to new issue to investigate.

Should we make a jaxrs-2.0 and 2.1 API feature with eeCompatible in it and have features depend on it instead of pulling in the bundle directly?

Probably, will add to the separate issue for private features.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,7 +8,8 @@ IBM-Process-Types: client, \
  server
 Subsystem-Name: Jakarta RESTful Web Services 3.0
 -features=\
-  io.openliberty.jakarta.activation-2.0
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.activation-2.0, \

commit.message: Add eeCompatible to private serlvet API features
